Add a comment stating why this number was chosen.
LGTM
Thanks. This was chosen based on experiments George ran over last few months.
I will see if I can gather more datapoints and paste them here

@chavdar , 
Could you take a look when you have a chance?

Thanks,
Jin

Added explanatory comment on OracleExtractor. Use all_tab_columns instead of user_tab_columns to fetch metadata. Take SID as input parameter.

@chavdar , Could you take a look (or delegate to others) when you have a chance? Once reviewed, I will resolve conflict with master branch.
Overall looks good. A few comments.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6651263/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6651263)

Changes Unknown when pulling **b3a61bdef795f14b0f53981acc5d5cb0336a128f on ibuenros:parallelize-commit-rebased** into *\* on linkedin:master**.

I went through the PR, and I only have a couple of feedbacks:
- we should add gobblin-cluster specific test cases, and
- we should have a gobblin-cluster launch script (that essentially takes a list of static nodes / ips and launches Gobblin on them) 

I will try to add those along with subsequent PRs around gobblin-cluster 

Note: Merging in the PR since its mostly refactoring and I tested the resultant code base on internal LinkedIn Yarn clusters and it works fine

LGTM. I have created ETL-4633 as a follow-up for the above code re-factorings.

Thanks @hibikir . Is there any way you can warn the user when their buffer size is not large enough?
It looks good other than that.

Thanks @autumnust 
I see that you took the apache file monitor and modified to work with `Path` instead. It's a great start, but we probably need to modify it to be more Gobblin-like in design (for example using safer `ThreadPool`s, using scheduled thread instead of `Thread.sleep`, etc.). The functionality will end up being very similar, so any tests for this will likely be useful for the refactoring as well.
Maybe a nice starting point is for you to document the current architecture of the monitor (couple paragraphs, maybe a nice diagram), so we can think from there how to refactor it.
While the policy should be runnable as a standalone job we should support running it via config store as well. It is difficult to refactor later to add that support.

Couple new comments, but it looks good.
After you address the comments, please pull the master branch `git pull --rebase upstream master`, squash your commits, and then we can merge.

@sahilTakiar It looks like I just experienced something similar which caused my Java 8 default Travis build to fail. It happened during my latest commit to [PR1074](https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1074)

From the raw log:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4194981/16524790/cfbdbdcc-3f66-11e6-894d-26711b154d32.jpg)

Sorry for the picture but I'm on my cell. Do you think this is related to this previous bug?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6838410/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6838410)

Coverage increased (+0.08%) to 46.181% when pulling **0c0136b6da06dd33bf4ed0d3ccfe252c6670f483 on ibuenros:commit-step-store** into **af7af9c0813f13e2acbe7e2d633cb4b0f66bc2db on linkedin:master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6841491/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6841491)

Coverage increased (+0.08%) to 46.226% when pulling **a2e9bae2f24f269e7a468e84cedc20c7fc6eafeb on ibuenros:commit-step-store** into **54fd005b1bb69e0042a01db544f2a55e532983a2 on linkedin:master**.

1. Event related changes in HiveMetaStoreBasedRegister.java and HiveMetaStoreEventHelper.java.
2. Current code, gobblin-core depend on gobblin-hive-registration, because MetricContext will be created using Instrumented which is in gobblin-core, this will cause the circular dependency
   Resolved it by 
   A: move gobblin.hive.HiveSerDeWrapper to gobblin-utility package
   B: BaseDataPublisherWithHiveRegistration.java from gobblin-core to gobblin-hive-registration
        HiveRegistrationPublisher.java  from gobblin-core to gobblin-hive-registration
3. Fixed one bug for SalesforceExtractor.java (complained by Findbug)

@chavdar , @ibuenros 
please review it when you have time

The test `JobConfigFileMonitorTest` has notoriously been very shaky on Travis. IIRC it fails semi often. Generally, just re-running the Travis build fixes it. It seems the Travis build for https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1074 is working now, so it shouldn't be an issue.

@jinhyukchang it seems @bjvanov has also created an `OracleSource` and `OracleExtractor`. Can you take a look at https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1074 and possibly work together to consolidate your efforts?
This thread on the Google Groups list is also relevant: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/gobblin-users/ljf2FwwvMp4/discussion
You may also be interested in https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1016

I still think the `GobblinRunnable` and `GobblinCallable` aren't necessary (its also going to be hard to enforce use of these classes throughout the code base.), moving the logic to `ExecutorsUtils.newThreadFactory` would be preferable.
